main_definition: Fully prepared, eager, or ready to do something without reservation or reluctance.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Ready and willing to help or cooperate.
meanings_and_examples.example: She was always willing to lend a hand when her friends needed assistance.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Prepared mentally and emotionally for something challenging or unpleasant.
meanings_and_examples.example: Despite the difficult task ahead, he was willing to face it head-on and overcome any obstacles.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Wanting or desiring something strongly; having a strong wish or desire.
meanings_and_examples.example: The children were eagerly willing for Christmas morning when they saw the presents under the tree.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Having no objection to doing something, typically implied as an alternative to reluctance.
meanings_and_examples.example: She was willing to try any new food, unlike her sister who would always turn up her nose at unfamiliar dishes.
